page.title: 19SECONDARY SCHOOLS IN SPILSBY
page.content: The county council is considering making changes in secondary education, because the birth rate is falling.We interviewed Mr Gourd the head master of King Edward V1 Grammar School.We asked him what he thought the council dicision on secondary Schools would be. He thought they would merge the Grammar School with Alford and keep a Secondary Modern School in Spilsby,but he was fighting for a Comprehensive with a Grammar stream.We next asked him why he thought we should still keep a Secondary School in Spilsby.He said because it provided education and also people won't have to move out of town or lose their jobs.If the schools close the teachers would be offered other jobs or be given early retirement.He thought Grammar School buildings would be needed by a bigger Franklin School.
